intro: Meliosma monophylla, commonly known as the single-leaf meliosma, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single, broad, elliptical leaf that is often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Meliosma monophylla is considered a vulnerable species.
